Exploring the wonderful town of Tournus @tournustourisme and @valleedelagastronomie ☀️🇫🇷🥖🧀🍇🍷❤️

The charming town of Tournus is on the Saone River in the Saone-et-Loire department of southern Burgundy. With a history dating back to The Romans, we loved exploring the vibrant town centre, with its colourful houses, narrow alleys, cute bakeries, wonderful cheese & chocolate shops, ceramics and artist studios, cafes and restaurants. 

The 10th century benedictine Abbey of Saint-Philibert de Tournus is a must visit! We also recommend a visit to Hôtel-Dieu - a hospital (now museum) built in the 17th century with a lovely garden.

Other highlights included…

🧀 Lunch @lerelaisdozenay -where the chef champions local producers including ceramics artists, cheese makers and regional wine makers. 

🍷 Dinner Cloître restaurant @hotel_spa_les7fontaines by chef @stephane_gregoire.69 - where traditional Burgundy dishes have been re-invented with a modern twist.

🏨 Overnight stay and lovely breakfast @hotel_spa_les7fontaines - loved our massive suite, overlooking the sunny courtyard and huge bathrooms with roll top bathtubs. Also just a stone's throw away from the local village shops and cafes too.

🥂 Wine tasting @lesvigneronsdemancey - an immersive and interactive experience, learning all about the soil, climate, scents and smells of the local wines and vineyards. 

🍽️ Lunch at 1 Michelin starred Les Terrasses restaurant by chef Jean-Michel Carrette @auxterrasses_jm_carrette - An absolutely delicious lunch here! The market menu changes daily, using seasonal ingredients from local farmers and followed by desserts in the beautiful garden terrace - full of herbs and flowers.

Thank you to my wonderful hosts! @tournustourisme @bourgognefranchecomte_tourisme @mybourgogne @valleedelagastronomie @explorefrance 🙏🏼🇫🇷❤️
